title: Change default auth_required_level from none to local_network
description:
## Context
The default network settings at `api/routers/settings.py:91` set `auth_required_level: none` which means no authentication by default. This is insecure.

## Requirements
1. Change default `auth_required_level` from `"none"` to `"local_network"`
2. This means auth will be required when accessing from local network or public internet
3. Localhost access will remain unauthenticated by default

## Files to modify
- `api/routers/settings.py` - line 91, change default value

## Notes
- This is a simple one-line change
- Existing users with explicit settings won't be affected
- New installations will be more secure by default
- Depends on: auth middleware being implemented first (otherwise this setting still does nothing)

title: Increase password strength requirements
description:
## Context
Current password validation at `api/routers/users.py:129` and `:193` only requires 4 characters minimum. This is trivially brute-forceable.

## Requirements
1. Increase minimum password length to 8 characters
2. Add complexity requirements:
   - At least one uppercase letter
   - At least one lowercase letter  
   - At least one number
3. Create a shared `validate_password()` function to avoid code duplication
4. Return helpful error messages explaining what's missing

## Files to modify
- `api/routers/users.py` - lines 129 and 193 for password validation

## Testing
- 'password' should fail (no uppercase, no number)
- 'Password1' should pass
- 'PASSWORD1' should fail (no lowercase)
- 'Pass1' should fail (too short)
